 DISALLOW_COPY_AND_ASSIGN (StyleSpan)

Detailed Description

Describes a style in a span.

Note that styles are cumulative -- if both bold and italic are set in separate spans, or if the base style is bold and a span calls for italic, you get bold italic. You can't turn off a style from the base style.

See also:
SpannableString SpannableStringBuilder

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

gaia::text::StyleSpan::StyleSpan ( int32_t  style) [explicit]
Parameters:
styleAn integer constant describing the style for this span. Examples include bold, italic, and normal. Values are constants defined in graphics::Typeface.
